name: Horse Side Tiny House
description:
Experience the unhurried backcountry retreat at Horse Side Tiny House, South Australia. The perfect farm stay nestled in wide-open spaces, native birdlife, and farm animals (e.g., such as horses, sheep, and alpacas) to keep you company. An amazing piece of paradise, where you can take deep calming breaths and lazy afternoon naps in Kapunda. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that the tiny house is only a short distance from the main street, so you may hear passing vehicles on the property.

The space
Horse Side Tiny House is located near Barossa Valley of South Australia, where you can rest and enjoy comfortable accommodation with easy access to water, split air conditioning, a kitchenette, cooking equipment, and excellent bathroom facilities.

The bathroom follows ecologically sustainable principles, including a cassette toilet with a removable waste-holding tank, hand basin, and shower (gas heated for hot showers) for you to use. It focuses on sat
neighborhood_overview:
Horse Side Tiny House sits in a small town near Barossa Valley in South Australia. Where you can explore restaurants, shops, and attractions for you to enjoy. So, make an endless list of things to do.

Our local recommendations:

- Pizza Bar and Takeaway serves a diverse selection of ingredients for dine-in and takeaway pizzas in town.
- One White Kite is a cafe that offers a delicious selection of pastries, light meals, coffee, and tea in Kapunda.
- Kapunda Mine Trail is a popular attraction that marks the first commercially copper metal mine in Australia.
- Kapunda Tourist Park is a camping and cabin accommodation set in a well-shaded park in Dutton Park, Kapunda.
- Whispering Wall is a popular attraction where "whispered words" can be heard 140 meters away from the other end of the dam.

If you want to know more, you can check out "Things to Do near Kapunda."
host_about: Tiny Away spearheads the tiny house eco-tourism in Australia. It started because of our desire to offer city dwellers the perfect place to escape from their hectic digital life in the city. Riding on the international trend in tiny houses, we have taken the tiny house movement one step further by partnering with land hosts and placing our beautifully designed and handcrafted tiny homes on wheels in spectacular rural settings. By integrating the concept of tiny houses with eco-tourism, we want to allow everyone a chance to experience the tiny house lifestyle - To Discover Nature and Stay in Comfort.

name: Situated in the beautiful Barossa Valley
description:
The Barossa is one of the worlds greatest producers of wine, boasting 150 wineries & 80 cellar doors. Home to the worlds oldest continuously producing vines. Taste the regions top wines and admire the area from a seat in a helicopter, hot air balloon, dine at some of the best restaurants and explore local villages, visit the big rocking horse, motor museum, chocolate factory, Gorge wild life park and 60min to SA's beaches.
Bring the whole family to this great place with lots of room for fun.
neighborhood_overview:
A peaceful location, within a very short walk to the Lyndoch village. The property is situated at the end of Bevilaqua terrace, opposite the village oval.
Easy walking distance to God's Hill, Kies and Kellermeister winery's, enjoy a relaxing glass of red with a cheese or cooked meat platter, while taking in the stunning views of the countryside. Or wander down to the beautiful historic Lyndoch village for a visit to the local bakery for coffee, or Lord Lyndoch Tavern for something stronger.
There are plenty of walking trails for the more adventurous guests, tennis courts, crickets nets and children's play ground within site of the property.

name: Tanunda Main.  Perfectly Located!
description:
Perfect getaway for singles, 1 or 2 couples, or parents with teens.

Tanunda main is a gorgeous 1915 built sandstone fronted cottage barely a 5 minute walk to the towns vibrant tourist centre. Suitable for up to 4 guests, It's a perfect location to relax, unwind, and meander down to great restaurants, pubs, cafe's and wine bars.

The space
It's a spacious and updated 2 bedroom symmetrical cottage with an easy floor plan, high ceilings, Baltic pine floorboards, leadlight windows and decorative fireplaces.

Lounge room with a reverse cycle air conditioner, DVD player and a 65inch TV.
Air conditioned country style kitchen with a gas cooktop and electric oven, fridge, microwave & cooking utensils.
A light filled dining space, rear deck with a bbq and an outdoor setting in the private fenced yard.
1 bathroom and toilet, and a washing machine for guests use.

Two bedrooms with King beds, ( suite 1 can be set up as si
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the Historical conservation area surrounded by other character homes. Close to all the town amenities, shops cafes and restaurants.

name: Ferment Suite - Hewitson Guest Suite
description:
FERMENT Guest Suite is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.
Take in the unparalleled views over the vineyard while enjoying a glass of Hewitson at the Tasting Room. As a guest you have the privilege to procure wines from The Hewitson Old & Rare Museum Cellar. Just ask!

The space
‘FERMENT’ Suite is a contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The Suite opens to a living room with a window bench seat with remote control curtains and a flat screen television. This adjoins a dining area with electric fireplace leading to a kitchenette including the mini-bar fridge and wine fridge stocked with super-premium Hewitson wines, dishwasher, sink with hot and cold water, toaster, toastie sandwich maker, microwave, kettle with
neighborhood_overview:
If FERMENT Suite is not available with your schedule, we have another guest room that you could find on Airbnb (CRUSH & PRESS Room) that might be available for you.
There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

name: Comfy Studio 3 @ Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is closed to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is a self-contained studio Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat, which can host 2 guests., The studio features a queen bed with starred-hotel linens, a kitchenette, and a bathroom.

In the common area, there are BBQ facilities and outdoor dining seating with a fantastic panoramic view. Outdoor fire pit is available outside of the fire danger season (1st May – 30th Nov). You can also find a shared laundry room on premises.

Other things
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is only a 5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is only a 5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: The Winemaker's Haus
description:
Live like a local and enjoy this stylish and spacious property, surrounded by vineyards just 2 minutes from Tanunda's main street. Inside you will find a fully equipped kitchen, lounge and dining room with woodburning stove and sunset views. Outside you will find a landscaped garden with a BBQ and veranda, fire pit and more spectacular vineyard view. Beyond the house take a 15-minute stroll into Tanunda and enjoy the Barossa's central hub with several restaurants, bars, pubs and a brewery.

The space
Our home is just right for families, couples or friends and has everything you need for a great stay. Little touches such as local coffee from Barossa Coffee Roasters and eco friendly cleaning & shower products from Zero Co mean all you need to bring is your bags.

Furry friends are welcome too, with a full enclosed garden!

Guest access
The whole house and garden are yours to enjoy. There is also a shed and garage which are off limits
neighborhood_overview: We are located just outside Tanunda, with its wineries, cafes, boutiques and restaurants. From the house it's a 5 minute walk to Turkey Flat winery or Barossa Valley Brewing, or take a 15 minute stroll into Tanunda for a coffee or bite to eat. Alternatively take a 10 minute drive to world famous wineries including Jacobs Creek, Seppeltsfield and Penfolds. Or simply stay at home and enjoy sunset over the vines, and maybe even moonrise over the hills on the right night.
host_about: I'm a restauranteur, chef and winemaker in the Barossa Valley. I moved to the Barossa from the UK to pursue my passion for wine. The Winemaker's Haus was our first home and the place where it all started for me and my wife. I am co-owner of Harvest Kitchen and produce wines under my own label - Haus Wine. With over 20 years of hospitality experience and an enthusiasm for all things food and drink I decided it was time to host my own guest house and help people discover the Barossa and all its wonder!

name: Tanunda House - Luxury 5 BR in Barossa Wine Region
description:
Prepare to be wowed as you enter this stunning home and discover your private luxury escape set on an acre of beautiful grounds in the heart of Tanunda. A 5 minute walk to excellent restaurants, cafes and wine bars, Tanunda House, with its 5 King bedrooms, pool, tennis court, wine cellar and theatre room is a perfect setting for a relaxing retreat or to celebrate a special occasion with friends, family or colleagues. It is also an ideal base for exploring the world renowned Barossa wine region.

The space
Immaculately presented, Tanunda House boasts the grandeur of its 1910 heritage in its front rooms with high pressed metal ceilings and the original stained glass entrance, then seamlessly moves into a stunning contemporary space featuring indoor and outdoor living/dining with floor to ceiling glass looking over the beautiful swimming pool and gardens. Everything you need, Tanunda House has on offer:

- Five spacious King Bedrooms three of which can be
neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda House is located in the attractive town of Tanunda which is the heart of the world renowned Barossa wine region. A walk around the neighbourhood will lead you down leafy streets past beautiful sandstone homes, historic cottages and a number of lovely old churches - a testament to the Lutheran settlement of the region. Only 50 metres from Tanunda House is Goat Square - an historic meeting place which is now a lovely green lawn surrounded on all sides by heritage 1840s stone cottages.
Restaurants, cafes and wine bars and a wonderfully eclectic selection of shops and galleries for browsing are a short 5 minute walk away from Tanunda House but if you get in your car you can be out driving past vineyards, wineries and charming villages within minutes.

neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding. There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub. Nearest supermarkets are 20 mins away.

name: Rockridge, apartment pet friendly rural setting
description:
Pet friendly rural farm stay. Newly renovated & fitted out apartment. Views overlooking tall gums & dam , listen to the kookaburras singing, say hi to our beautiful friendly horses. Walking distance to township filled with some unique shops. Farmers market held each Saturday morning just a mere walk down the driveway.
An easy drive to the beautiful Barossa Valley wine region to taste all the Barossa has to offer.
Close to Mt Crawford forest for those who like to be do some bush walking

The space
Your space is at ground level overlooking our property Modern open plan area, quiet location. Kitchen appointed with microwave, induction hot plate, fridge / freezer , coffee maker. Spacious bathroom / ensuite.
QS bed quality linen.
Flat screen wall mounted smart tv, internet , wifi available. You will have the entire ground floor area to yourself, private courtyard with Baby Q webber for bbq cooking, table and chairs which looks out across our hor
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to township where you can find some quirky shops, a fabulous gin distillery called Robbers Dog a must visit.
Rustic Edge home and western wear filled with amazing gifts and clothing and flowers.
As we are the gateway to Barossa Valley wine region it’s a short drive to experience all the valley has to offer.
Into a bit of bush walking ? Mt Crawford forest just down the road some lovely bush trails to explore.
Travel east and you will find the River Murray and Mannum Falls. Another short drive takes you into the heart of Adelaide Hills so much to see there the iconic town Hahndorf.
As you can see we are very central to so much.

name: 65 on North
description:
This modern, studio style suite has everything you need for a wonderful stay in the Barossa Valley. With only a short 10 minute stroll into the heart of Angaston, you can visit a range of coffee shops and eateries, or take a drive to some world-renowned wineries. After a day out exploring, wind down with a wine and a luxe charcuterie board at sunset in your own private courtyard space overlooking the Angaston hills.

The space
The guest suite is part of a newly built rural property and all the features are bright, modern and clean. Mod cons include a reverse cycle air conditioner/heater. Enjoy some down time in front the 50' smart TV. You will have access to a small range of cooking facilities including a BBQ in your own outdoor area.

Guest access
Guests have their own private parking which leads to the entrance-way to the suite. Enjoy views of the rolling hills of Angaston in your private courtyard area, including the famous Yalumba Winer
neighborhood_overview: The peaceful, leafy township of Angaston holds all the charm and character you will come to expect. While we share fences with our neighbours, visible physical buildings from your room is minimal.

name: Three bedroom Vineyard View Villa @ Blickinstal Retreat
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is close to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is a self-contained villa in Blickinstal Retreat, which can host 6 guests, The villa features three separate bedrooms with starred-hotel linens, a living room, a well-functioned kitchen, and a laundry. The villa provides a relaxed and intimate space with stunning views over the vineyard.

• Master Suite – Double Bed with Airconditioning
• Bedroom 2 – Queen Bed
• Bedroom 3 – Queen Bed
Living room - with Airconditioning
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is onlya  5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: Para River Cottage
description:
‘Para River Cottage’

Built in 1920 overlooking the gum studded cliff face of the North Para River, this quaint and cosy cottage has been elegantly restored for your fulfilment.

Embrace the quiet rural feel of native birdsong and scattered sheep across the way, all whilst being within a short stroll of the heart of Tanunda.

It’s a great spot to discover the Barossa Valley and a lovely neighbourhood. I have so many great memories here, and I’m convinced that you will too.

name: Spacious Queen Bedroom
description:
Forget your worries in this spacious and serene space located in the heart of Kapunda- the wine-growing industry centred in the nearby Barossa Valley.

The space
Enjoy this spacious private queen bedroom in a 3-bedroom home with a nice, quiet and relaxing big backyard located in one of pretty towns in the Barossa Valley- Kapunda.

Guest access
Enjoy access to shared common areas like living, dining, kitchen, toilet, bathroom, laundry, front and backyard.

Other things to note
Need more space? I have another double bedroom for booking in the same 3-bedroom home.

name: Gabby's Holiday House w Pool and Vineyard
description:
Gabby's Holiday House provides a relaxed and intimate space for those who looks for an escape to a vineyard. Here you can enjoy the beautiful scenery of Barossa and feel at home. During summer time, you can take a swim in the private pool with your friends and family. While in the winter, the indoor fireplace offers a cheerful area to gather around.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is close to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This beautiful and comfortable house is perfect for small groups of friends and families as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is a self-contained house with 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms

• Bedroom 1 – a King Bed
• Bedroom 2 – a Queen Bed ( and a Queen-size mattress with 8pp booking)
• Bedroom 3 – a Queen Bed

• Bathroom 1 - Shower and Toilet
• Bathroom 2 - Bath, Shower with no toilet
• Bathroom 3 - Shower and Toilet ( outside th
neighborhood_overview: Gabby's Holiday House is lcoated in a quiet neighbourhood where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants are around. It is only few minute drive to Barossa Central and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: B/New Barossa Valley House! Walk 2 Tanunda Main St
description:
Stay at Dwelle Barossa Valley Retreat, located in walking distance to all that Tanunda has to offer - great shops, restaurants, pubs, cafes & wine bars (and just a short drive to world-famous wineries). This lovely, modern house is completely brand new (as of Dec 2022) and located in one of Tanunda's best streets. It's quite minimal at this stage, but if you're happy to be in a beautiful, brand new house in an amazing location, then we look forward to hosting you!

The space
The house features a large open-plan living/dining area and full kitchen, laundry, double driveway and alfresco area with seating.

There is one large bedroom with a comfortable queen bed (with walk-in-robe and ensuite with bathtub).

There is also a sofa bed in the study that is suitable for a child. You are free to use it, if you are happy to bring your own linen for it.

All other linen and towels are provided.

We have reverse-cycle, ducted heating a
neighborhood_overview: The heart of the Barossa, Tanunda sits in prime position surrounded by the region’s best wineries. Sample wine straight from the barrel at Château Tanunda, go back to (wine) school at Greenock Estates or sip bold reds in a heritage stone barn at Rockford Wines. Wander down leafy streets dotted with heritage buildings, stop for lunch at Vino Lokal, or dig into dinner at Harvest Kitchen. Down the road, discover Seppeltsfield; home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Hentley Farm Restaurant and Seppeltsfield Road Distillers.
host_about: Hi, I'm John. I'm enjoying semi-retirement and love playing bowls, golf, and catching up with friends for a nice meal and a glass of wine (from the Barossa of course).

name: Barossa Bungalow -vineyard views/acreage
description:
Cozy accommodation amongst the vineyards in the heart of the Barossa Valley.

Our beautiful 3 bedroom bungalow sleeps 6 guests. Situated on over 2 acres of classic Barossa terrain, this tranquil property has vineyard and hills views and is only a 15 minute walk or 2 minute drive to the main street of Tanunda.

The space
Acreage property, completely private. 3 bedrooms, one King Bed, one Queen Bed and one single bunk bed. Please note that the bunk bedroom is attached to the house, however you have to walk outside to access it. Please see map in photos for reference. One bathroom with separate toilet room. Fully functioning kitchen.

Guest access
Guests will have private access to over 2 acres of property.

name: Riesling Apartment - Angaston Mews
description:
Enjoy easy access to everything from this perfectly located home base.

The space
At Angaston Mews Apartments you can enjoy modern apartment style living with all amenities, including free WiFi. Recently updated, each of our four apartments are perfect for couples, families, group get-togethers or corporate travellers.

Apartments offer a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher. Other features include lounge/dining, Tv, air-conditioning, two bedrooms, one bathroom with double size shower. Standard bedroom configuration is two king beds, Kings may be split into singles or singles joined to be one king. A double sofa bed is available for 2 guests.

Each apartment has a patio area and laundry facilities are provided. Outdoors there is undercover parking, a barbecue/outdoor entertaining area.

Angaston is home to the Barossa Farmers Market and is just a short drive to well renowned wineries in the Barossa Valley. Strolling through Angas

name: Shady acres.
description:
This fully furnished,self-contained, stand alone, two bedrooms plus sofa bed, guest unit is nestled on ten acres. It is private, well off the main road, pet friendly with private backyard.

The main house is 200m away.

Yards for horses are opposite the unit. Dressage arena and 650m track are available.

Close by trail riding, cycling/ walking paths, historical townships (Gawler, Two Wells).

Barossa Valley is 25km away.

Come enjoy peace and quiet, whilst being close to amenities.

The space
This fully furnished, self- contained, stand alone, two bedrooms plus sofa bed, guest unit is nestled amongst the trees on ten acres. It is private and well off the main road. The main house is 200mts away. The unit is pet friendly (max 2 dogs). It has it's own fully fenced backyard, complete with BBQ and pergola.

There is ample parking, more than enough for horse floats.

Pets and horses are wel

name: Gum Park Guest house
description:
A picturesque one-hectare property located 3 kilometers out of Kapunda. A short drive to both the Barossa Valley and Clare Valley, this guest house offers a unique country experience whilst being part of the family.

The space
About The Property
The guest house is alongside the main homestead where our family of four, 2 adults and 2 children, reside.
There are animals on the property including a Labrador puppy, a pet sheep, pet chickens (all named and very friendly), beehives and native animals to the area.

Sleeping
2 bedrooms with Queen size beds
Sofa lounge with double bed

Amenities
The guest house has a newly renovated kitchen and bathroom.
There is an inground swimming pool for all to enjoy with towels provided.
Enjoy the tranquil view from the verandah.

name: Petit Manor
description:
Petit Manor is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley on 50 picturesque acres of land with rolling farmland, trees and hills. Perfect for a romantic getaway, the tiny house is set in a scenic location surrounded by alpacas and provides a pleasing blend of modern conveniences in a tranquil setting. It has one bedroom with a queen size bed, a small kitchen and lounge area, it also has a deck and verandah that you can enjoy any time of day. We are approx 1 hour from the city.

The space
We are a working alpaca farm and will often be doing work in the paddocks, we will also be using the tractor, sometimes near the tiny house. This space is not remote, it is close to our house and the other bnb but it is tucked up behind the sheds.

Guest access
Guests can walk around our property but we ask that they do not enter any gates that are closed as we move animals around all the time. They can look around at the gardens, they can also go for a
neighborhood_overview: We are approx 5 mins from Birdwood where you will find a supermarket, pub, bakery, takeaway and other small shops.  We are located approx 1 hour from the city and half an hour to Tanunda, approx 20 mins to Woodside. Sites to see are Gumeracha Rocking Horse, Lavender Farm, Whispering Wall, Hiking trails, nature walks, Warren reservoir where you can hire kayaks, Birdwood Motor Museum and lots of wineries.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

description:
The Fergusson House is situated in Lyndoch, the heart of the Barossa Valley wine district. Perfect for groups to enjoy, or family holidays, and an added bonus of being pet friendly. A comfortable private house that sleeps 8, making for a memorable Barossa experience that can be used as a base while exploring The Barossa Valley / or a relaxing getaway with a 6-seater therapeutic spa to enjoy. Ample parking including enough space for a caravan or boat. Available for short and long-term stays.

The space
The Fergusson House has 4 bedrooms, 2 living rooms, and 2 large outdoor entertaining areas which includes a 6 -seater therapeutic spa.

The main bedroom is located in its own private wing and has a queen bed, smart tv, an extra living area with a sofa bed, ensuite, and its own access to the outdoor entertaining area. Also has reverse-cycle air conditioning.

The other three bedrooms are off the second wing.
The second bedroom includes a queen

Main bedroom has a king bed, 3 bedrooms have queen beds, and the fifth bedroom has a bunk with double on the base, single on the top. All linen is professionally laundered by Alsco linen service. We are in the heart of the Barossa Valley. We manage the property ourselves and are particularly clean conscious!.

The space
We have 2 main living areas. A formal lounge for peaceful relaxation, large family room with air conditioning and a cosy slow combustion fireplace for winter!. There is also another entertaining room off the main living with a pool table!!. This provides a little fun for the guests!. The main dining table seats 8 comfortably. This property is newly listed as an ideal corporate function centre with 12 large bedrooms, 9 with ensuites, a huge reconfigurable conference room which can seat up to 20 around the conference table. The large dining room adjacent to the fully optioned kitchen can cater for up to 24 guests.
The extensive lawn areas mean that it is also well suited as a wedding venue.

name: The Jolly Folly - self contained guest wing
description:
Perfectly situated in the very heart of Tanunda, The Jolly Folly is just two minutes stroll from the region’s best restaurants, bars, cafes and shops. This fabulously styled, self-contained guest wing is the perfect place to relax and explore everything the gorgeous Barossa Valley has to offer.

The space
The Jolly Folly is comprised of a private bedroom, living room, bathroom and toilet. Entry is via the garden and through one of the separate entrance doors. A locked door separates the guest's wing from the host's house.

The bedroom is a calm and restful space perfect for a great night’s sleep. The super- comfortable bed is queen sized with high quality linens and pillows. There is a desk if you need to work. Drawer space and hanging rail are provided.

The living-room is a cosy hangout with a smart TV so you can log in to your regular streaming channel subscriptions or watch free to air. Everything you need to make tea and coffee is provided
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is the beating heart of the Barossa Valley. It is a beautiful, safe country town with a vibrant, cosmopolitan restaurant, bar and café scene. There is a great art gallery and a wide range of high-end shops as well as the usual country pubs and bakeries. The best of both worlds!
host_about: I live in the beautiful Barossa Valley in South Australia with my partner Ben, our two dogs and various kids who come and go. Originally from the UK I have lived in the Barossa for around 15 years so have plenty of local knowledge to share with guests if they need some local tips.

name: Tanunda Central Cottage
description:
Welcome to our charming cottage in the heart of Tanunda Main Street, Barossa Valley. This recently renovated property has been beautifully restored and offers a comfortable and stylish stay in one of South Australia's most sought-after destinations.

Originally built in 1856, the cottage formed part of the original pharmacy in Tanunda. Today, it is a cozy two-bedroom retreat with all the modern amenities you need for a memorable stay.

The space
The first bedroom features a king and a single bed, while the second bedroom has a comfortable queen bed. In total, the property can sleep up to five guests.

The kitchen is equipped with a cooktop and a microwave convection oven, with cafes, restaurants, and wine bars mere steps from your front door. There is also air conditioning and heating throughout the property to keep you comfortable no matter the season.

Outside, the private courtyard offers a space to relax and unwind. There is outdo
neighborhood_overview: Tanunda is a town in the Barossa Valley region of South Australia, and it is known for its wineries and German heritage. The neighborhood is characterized by quaint, historic buildings and tree-lined streets. It has a population of around 4,000 people and offers a range of amenities, including shops, restaurants, and parks.

Marananga Cottages are located in the heart of Marananga, an ideal venue from which to experience the delights of the Barossa Valley.

name: Delightful Cottage
description: In a quaint but busy village of Greenock lies the original cobblers cottage. A winemakers Bolthole where many a night of wine tasting, blending blends and savouring old vintages have been had. A stones throw to numerous other boutique wineries, a brewery, El Estanco cafe & the pub at the bottom of the street, just a few mins walk. Three generous main rooms with polished original leather stained concrete & timber floors. Texture & patina from a rich history as the original boot-makers cottage.

name: Daisy’s Place - spacious house
description:
Located in a quiet neighbourhood, only 15 min walk to the main street shops, cafes and restaurants.
Large house with plenty of space. The house has two spacious living areas, which is perfect for a family that need some extra room.
The open plan kitchen and dining, and the outdoor entertaining area, is great for a group of friends staying. There is also a nice lawn space for the kids to enjoy some games.
There is also a desk for those who are travelling for work.
neighborhood_overview: Quite neighbourhood, with lovely neighbours.
host_about:
I have lived in the Barossa for over 26 years. I love to call the Barossa home and enjoy sharing knowledge of what our beautiful region has to offer. I have worked in hospitality and the wine industry for 19 years, and customer service is a passion.
I love to explore other regions and have enjoyed several overseas holidays in the last 5 years, staying in several airbnb accommodation.
